snippet: “Yoko Ono: One Woman Show, 1960-1971,” including 125 of Ms. Ono’s early installations, audio recordings and works on paper, is to open in May.
abstract: “Yoko Ono: One Woman Show, 1960-1971,” including 125 of Ms. Ono’s early installations, audio recordings and works on paper, is to open in May.
lead_paragraph: In December 1971, Yoko Ono presented a conceptual work at the Museum of Modern Art – sort of. The typically prankish piece purported to be a solo exhibition by Ms. Ono at the museum. But though she advertised the show and printed a catalog for it, the show was unauthorized, and none of Ms. Ono’s work was on display, except for a sign she posted at the entrance telling visitors that she had released flies at the museum, and that everyone was invited to track them down throughout the city.

headline.main: MoMA Plans a Yoko Ono Show
